subject: Re: [junit] ? access current test method name, in setUp() and tearDown()
msgSnippet: If you re using the standard reflective stuff, you can just reference the name of the TestCase ... From: Alain RAVET  To:
messageBody:
If you're using the standard reflective stuff, you can just reference the name of the TestCase


----- Original Message -----
From: "Alain RAVET" <aravet@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, July 23, 2001 2:03 PM
Subject: [junit] ? access current test method name, in setUp() and tearDown()


> Hi,
>
> I wonder if there is a way to obtain the name of the current test method,
> when you are in setUp() or tearDown()?
>
>
> Usage :
>
>
> public void tearDown()
> {
> System.out.println ("You have just executed : " +
> <method_name_comes_here> ) ;
> printSomeInfoHere () ;
> }
>
>
> Alain Ravet
> Brussels, Belgium
>
>
